etymology.interpretation: Historically used as an administrative place name, the pairing evokes the sense of establishing or “opening” a fief/settlement. Later dynasties used it for the prefecture and capital centered at today’s Kaifeng.
etymology.simplification: 開 → 开 simplified by reducing the 門 ‘door’ component to fewer strokes; 封 unchanged.

parts.english: to open; to start; to operate (a machine/vehicle); to expand/develop
to seal; to confer (a title/fief); measure word for letters; to enclose

examples.chinese: 我打算去开封旅游(我打算去開封旅遊)。
examples.english: I plan to travel to Kaifeng.

examples.chinese: 宋代时(宋代時)，开封是首都(開封是首都)。
examples.english: During the Song dynasty, Kaifeng was the capital.

examples.chinese: 开封的夜市很热闹(開封的夜市很熱鬧)。
examples.english: Kaifeng’s night market is very lively.
